keyword: average calories in a slice of pizza
title: Average Calories in a Slice of Pizza
meta_description: Discover the average calories in a slice of pizza—around 285 kcal—plus carbs, protein, fat, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
h1: Average Calories in a Slice of Pizza
assumptions: Standard 14-inch cheese pizza, one slice (1/8 of pie, ~110g), thin crust, mozzarella cheese, tomato sauce; no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pizza size, crust type, toppings, brand, and preparation. Check labels or restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: An average slice of cheese pizza contains about 285 calories and 12g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Veggie toppings (e.g., peppers, onions) instead of meat

faqs.q: What is the average calories in a slice of pizza?
faqs.a: About 285 kcal for a standard cheese slice.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a slice of pizza?
faqs.a: Roughly 35g carbs, including 2g fiber, per average slice.

faqs.q: Does pizza slice calories vary by toppings?
faqs.a: Yes—meat toppings add 50+ kcal; veggies may reduce by 20 kcal.

faqs.q: What about sodium in a pizza slice?
faqs.a: Around 600mg per slice, mostly from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: Are calories higher for deep-dish pizza?
faqs.a: Yes, a deep-dish slice can add 100+ kcal due to thicker crust.
